segments.text: I notice the woman, so absorbed, almost as if she’s in a different world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: While she polishes her plate, the water pools at her feet, slowly but surely.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is a curious sight, chasing after cookies with a mix of defiance and urgency.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout at him to be careful, but somehow, I don’t want to ruin this moment for him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Seeing the girl’s outstretched hand fills me with a warmth, despite the potential disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s both sweet and naive, this little collaboration of theirs.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, I feel a wave of disgust at how easily they ignore the rules, the dangers.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This kitchen, so ordinary, is slowly morphing into something chaotic, yet delightful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but think of the delicate balance of childhood, so carefree yet so precarious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hold my breath, waiting for the moment everything could tip over.
segments.speaker: PAR
